clinical_study.brief_title: Spouses/Partners Expressing Their Thoughts After Transplant

brief_summary.textblock: This study seeks to test a brief psychological intervention for spousal caregivers of cancer patients (specifically, hematopoietic stem cell transplant patients), persons known to experience emotional distress.

detailed_description.textblock: This project focuses on spousal caregivers (CGs) of hematopoietic stem cell transplant survivors - persons known to report elevated levels of distress as compared to both norms and their patient counterparts. Specific Aims are to: (1) Determine, via experimental manipulation, whether or not CGs of hematopoietic stem cell transplant patients engage in protective buffering, a coping mechanism whereby partners shield patients from illness-related concerns or worries, (2) Examine synchrony or lack thereof, desynchrony, among subjective, expressive and biologic indicators of emotion among spousal CGs, and (3) Test the feasibility and implementation of an emotional expression (EE) exercise designed to enhance psychological and immune functioning among spousal CGs.

primary_outcome.measure: Self-reported mental and physical health as measured by the Short Form-36 Health Survey
Marital satisfaction as measured by the Dyadic Adjustment Scale
Self- and partner-reported protective buffering as measured by the Protective Buffering Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Emotional experience as assessed by the Positive and Negative Affect Schedule
Galvanic skin response (physiological indicator of emotion)
Emotional expression (facial expression and words uttered)

arm_group.description: Caregivers are asked to talk about their deepest thoughts and feelings regarding the patient's transplant and their role as caregiver, in the presence of the patient (one session).
Caregivers are asked to talk about their deepest thoughts and feelings regarding the patient's transplant and their role as caregiver, in the absence of the patient (3 sessions).
Caregivers are asked to talk about their plans for the upcoming week (time management, sessions 1 and 3) and positive aspects of their life (session 2).

intervention.description: Caregivers are given the opportunity to express their thoughts and feelings regarding the patient's transplant and their role as caregiver

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients and partners at least 21 years of age
- patients and partners English speaking
- patients about to receive a hematopoietic stem cell transplant
- patients married or in a committed, cohabiting, heterosexual or homosexual relationship
- caregivers in a married or committed, cohabiting, heterosexual or homosexual relationship with the patient
- caregivers present at the transplant site and planning to remain so for at least one month
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient major psychiatric disorder
- caregiver presence or history of a neurologic disorder
